member.name: F:paycircuit.com.google.iap.InAppItemObject._iat
member.summary: Note the adjustment of -1 minute to compensate for differences between system times when generating iat, adjust as necessary. If your system clock is faster than Google's, your JWT will be rejected (jwt spec: the current date/time MUST be after the issued date/time listed in the iat claim) Also note leap seconds in Windows vs nix.
member.remarks: Sorry #rapture fans: If the world still exists on 01/19/2038, this is an issue (Integer)

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.InAppItemObject.iss
member.summary: Required. Issuer Claim. Your Merchant/Seller ID. On Postback from Google: This will be set by Google to "Google", and will be verified (case-sensitive). Adjust callback handler as needed.

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.InAppItemObject.aud
member.summary: Required. Audience Claim. Default is "Google". Provide value for future api version changes. On Postback from Google: This will be set by Google to your Merchant/Seller ID and will be verified. Adjust callback handler as needed

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.InAppItemObject.typ
member.summary: Required. Type Claim. Default is "google/payments/inapp/item/v1". Provide value for future api version changes. On Postback from Google: This will be set by Google and will be verified. Currently "google/payments/inapp/item/v1/postback/buy". Adjust callback handler as needed.

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.InAppItemObject.iat
member.summary: Required. Issued At Claim. The time when the JWT was issued. Specified in number of seconds from 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z as measured in UTC until the desired date/time. Default value is current server time with a clock adjustment of -1 minute. On Postback from Google: Google will set this value and will be verified.

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.InAppItemObject.exp
member.summary: Optional. Expiration claim. Must be greater than issued at (iat) and maximum of 1 hour after issued at (iat). Specified in number of seconds from 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z as measured in UTC until the desired date/time. On Postback from Google: Google will set this value and will be verified.

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.InAppItemObject.request
member.summary: Required. Instance of InAppItemRequestObject.

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.InAppItemObject.response
member.summary: Used only on Google Postback Contains orderID

member.name: M:paycircuit.com.google.iap.InAppItemObject.#ctor
member.summary: When using this constructor, refer to property Intellisense documentation/information/hints for requirements. Refer to Google documentation.

member.name: M:paycircuit.com.google.iap.InAppItemObject.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: This constructor initializes a new InAppItemRequestObject. Text values exceeding maximum length requirements will be truncated. Use named arguments for optional parameters if you don't provide all.
member.param: Required (name). Maximium of 50 characters (excess truncated).
Optional (description). Pass null, Nothing or String.Empty to prevent serialization of this property. Maximum of 100 characters (excess truncated).
Required (price). Up to 2 decimal places only. Google will reject value exceeding 2 decimal places.
Required (isoCurrencyCode). 3 letter ISO Currency. e.g. USD (excess truncated).
Optional (sellerData). Pass null, Nothing or String.Empty to prevent serialization of this property. Maximum of 200 characters (excess truncated).
Required (iss). Your Seller ID when building your JWT (you are issuer). On postback, Google is issuer and will set this value ("Google").
Optional (exp). Maximium value is 60 (minutes from iat). Pass null or Nothing to prevent serialization of this property.
This is an optional parameter. Use only to override default aud value ("Google").
This is an optional parameter. Use only to override default typ value ("google/payments/inapp/item/v1").
This is an optional parameter. Use only to override default iat value (current UTC time in number of seconds from Unix epoch with skew of -60 secs).

member.name: T:paycircuit.com.google.iap.InAppItemObject
member.summary: Google In-App Payments specific JWT implementation

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.InAppItemRequestObject.currencyCode
member.summary: Required. A 3-character currency code that defines the billing currency. Currently the only supported currency code is USD.

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.InAppItemRequestObject.price
member.summary: Required. The purchase price of the item, with up to 2 decimal places. Google will reject value exceeding 2 decimal places.

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.InAppItemRequestObject.sellerData
member.summary: Optional: Data to be passed to your success and failure callbacks. The string can have no more than 200 characters.

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.InAppItemRequestObject.name
member.summary: Required. The name of the item. This name is displayed prominently in the purchase flow UI and can have no more than 50 characters.

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.InAppItemRequestObject.description
member.summary: Optional: Text that describes the item. This description is displayed in the purchase flow UI and can have no more than 100 characters.

member.name: M:paycircuit.com.google.iap.InAppItemRequestObject.#ctor
member.summary: Refer to property Intellisense documentation/information/hints for requirements (will throw exception).

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.InAppItemResponseObject.orderId
member.summary: A unique identifier for this transaction (this is set by Google on postback)

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.JWTHeader.alg
member.summary: The alg (algorithm) header parameter identifies the cryptographic algorithm used to secure the JWS. The processing of the alg (algorithm) header parameter, if present, requires that the value of the alg header parameter MUST be one that is both supported and for which there exists a key for use with that algorithm associated with the signer of the content. The alg parameter value is case sensitive. This header parameter is REQUIRED.
member.remarks: Note possible conflicting spec verbiage: Required vs. "if present"

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.JWTHeader.kid
member.summary: The kid (key ID) header parameter is a hint indicating which specific key owned by the signer should be used to validate the signature. This allows signers to explicitly signal a change of key to recipients. Omitting this parameter is equivalent to setting it to an empty string. The interpretation of the contents of the kid parameter is unspecified. This header parameter is OPTIONAL.

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.JWTHeader.typ
member.summary: The typ (type) header parameter is used to declare the type of the signed content. The typ value is case sensitive. This header parameter is OPTIONAL. Possible values: "JWT" or "http://openid.net/specs/jwt/1.0".

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.JWTHeader.jku
member.summary: The jku (JSON Key URL) header parameter is a URL that points to JSON-encoded public keys that can be used to validate the signature. The keys MUST be encoded as per the JSON Web Key (JWK) [JWK] specification. This header parameter is OPTIONAL.

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.JWTHeader.x5u
member.summary: The x5u (X.509 URL) header parameter is a URL utilizing TLS RFC 5785 [RFC5785] that points to an X.509 public key certificate or certificate chain that can be used to validate the signature. This certificate or certificate chain MUST use the PEM encoding RFC 1421 [RFC1421] and MUST conform to RFC 5280 [RFC5280]. This header parameter is OPTIONAL.

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.JWTHeader.x5t
member.summary: The x5t (x.509 certificate thumbprint) header parameter provides a base64url encoded SHA-1 thumbprint (a.k.a. digest) of the DER encoding of an X.509 certificate that can be used to match the certificate. This header parameter is OPTIONAL.

member.name: T:paycircuit.com.google.iap.JWTHeaderObject.JWTHash
member.summary: 06/21/2011: In-App Payments API currently uses JWT v1 and HMAC SHA-256 encryption

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.JWTClaim.iss
member.summary: The iss (issuer) claim identifies the principal that issued the JWT. The processing of this claim is generally application specific. The iss value is case sensitive. This claim is OPTIONAL.

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.JWTClaim.aud
member.summary: The aud (audience) claim identifies the audience that the JWT is intended for. The principal intended to process the JWT MUST be identified by the value of the audience claim. If the principal processing the claim does not identify itself with the identifier in the aud claim value then the JWT MUST be rejected. The interpretation of the contents of the audience value is generally application specific. The aud value is case sensitive. This claim is OPTIONAL.

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.JWTClaim.typ
member.summary: The typ (type) claim is used to declare a type for the contents of this JWT. The typ value is case sensitive. This claim is OPTIONAL.

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.JWTClaim.iat
member.summary: The iat (issued at) claim identifies the UTC time at which the JWT was issued. The processing of the iat claim requires that the current date/time MUST be after the issued date/time listed in the iat claim. Implementers MAY provide for some small leeway, usually no more than a few minutes, to account for clock skew. This claim is OPTIONAL.

member.name: P:paycircuit.com.google.iap.JWTClaim.exp
member.summary: The exp (expiration time) claim identifies the expiration time on or after which the token MUST NOT be accepted for processing. The processing of the exp claim requires that the current date/time MUST be before the expiration date/time listed in the exp claim. Implementers MAY provide for some small leeway, usually no more than a few minutes, to account for clock skew. This claim is OPTIONAL.

member.name: F:paycircuit.com.google.iap.JWTHelpers.UNIX_EPOCH_TICKS
member.summary: DateTime(1970, 1, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, DateTimeKind.Utc).Ticks = 621355968000000000

member.name: M:paycircuit.com.google.iap.JWTHelpers.verifyJWT(System.String,System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Verify JWT (header test and signature matching only)
member.param: The raw JWT string to parse
Your Seller Secret
out: string for deserializing to JWTHeaderObject if TRUE
out: string for deserializing to InAppItemObject if TRUE

member.name: M:paycircuit.com.google.iap.JWTHelpers.verifyJWT(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,paycircuit.com.google.iap.JWTHeaderObject@,paycircuit.com.google.iap.InAppItemObject@)
member.summary: A stricter JWT verification routine. Verifies values in header and payload (not just signuature matching).
member.param: Issuer claim: will be compared with JWT iss. Currently "Google" (case-sensitive).
Audience claim: will be compared with JWT aud. Must match your Merchant/Seller ID (case-sensitive).
Type Claim: will by compared with JWT typ. Currently "goog.payments.inapp.buyItem.v1.postback"
Minute(s) to adjust your clock. 0 for no adjustment. Behavior: add when verifying iat, subtract when verifying exp. Restrict to a few mintues only.
The raw JWT string to parse
Your Seller Secret
out: JWTHeaderObject
out: InAppItemObject

member.param: String to parse
member.returns: JWTHeaderObject.JWTHash enum (returns JWTHeaderObject.JWTHash.none if match is not found). Google In-App Payments currently only uses HS256 (06/2011)
